fol.84v
To
e right honorable my very singular good Lord the L. Burghley Lord highe Treasurer of England
vij Au
g
1594 M
r
Bodeley to my L.
To have direction towchinge hir
Ma
ties
determination for shippinge to be employed for
Britaigne
./
x shipp
will be redy at
e do
w
s w
t
in x dayes
7 Au
g
94
page.lettertext:
fol.83r
May it please yo
r
good L. I can not but ad-
vertise,
at I am called on continually, to signifie to
the states, w
at
her Ma
tie
hath resolved for
e service
of Britaine. But knowing no more of it, then I did
at
e first, of her general purpose, I can make no other
answear. I see no want of willingnesse in any of
e
Provinces,
to assist her Hig
es
very thorowly: but their
chiefest desire is to have it speedely attempted, and w
t
p rovision sufficient of all kinde of necessaries, stan-
ding otherwise in feare,
at ether they shall not effect
their designe, or effect it w
t
more difficultie, and w
t
greater losse of time, and expenses, then there would
have bin at first by many degrees. They doe prepare
to sette fourth
10 of their best shippes, and I thinke
of them
e greater part will be at
e downes w
t
in
these 10 daies.
Howbeit I doe see by their com-
plaintes,
at if they come not so provided, as
e service
shall require, or her Ma
tie
expect, they will impute
it altogether to
e want
at they have had of parti-
cular advertisment of her Hig
es
preparation, and other
needefull circumstances. In w
ch
respect considering
howe
e winde hath bin west and westerly, for almost
these two monethes, for w
ch
it may be doubted, lest nowe
being Esterly, it will continue so long, I thinke it ex-
pedient to put yo
r
L. in minde,
at some extraordi-
narie charge may be given to him
at bringes yo
r
l
re
s,
that if he finde a contrarie winde, he should take
some pinnace for his passage, w
ch
wilbe able in faire we-
ther to tide it over easely, although
e winde be cleane
against her.
And so referring yo
r
L. for all other
maters to my former l
re
s, I take my humble leave.
From
e Hage. Au
g
7 1594.
Yo
r
L. most humble at commaundem
t
. Tho. Bodley
